text: Bluff City is a city in Harper County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 45 people lived there. ==History== Bluff City was created about 1879. The city was named after Bluff Creek, which goes near it. Bluff City was a station and shipping point on the Kansas Southwestern Railway. ==Geography== Bluff City is at (37.075671, -97.875376). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Bluff City has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system, Bluff City has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Bluff City, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 45 people, 21 households, and 11 families living in Bluff City. Of the households, 76.2% owned their home and 23.8% rented their home. The median age was 53.3 years. Of the people, 88.9% were White and 11.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 8.9% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 65 people, 29 households, and 13 families living in Bluff City. ==Education== Bluff City is a part of USD 361 Chaparral Schools. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Bluff City - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 361, local school district ;Maps * Bluff City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Harper County, Kansas
